title: Business Live: Wall Street gyrates - BBC News
summary: express sold to trinity mirror for £ 126m .

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's all we have time for on business live today and this week - thanks for reading .
we are back bright and early on monday at 06:00 so do join us then .

documents.title: russian nuclear scientists arrested for 'bitcoin mining plot '
text: russian security officers have arrested several scientists working at a top-secret russian nuclear warhead facility for allegedly mining crypto-currencies .
the suspects had tried to use one of russia 's most powerful supercomputers to mine bitcoins , media reports say .
the federal nuclear centre in sarov , western russia , is a restricted area .
the centre 's press service said : `` there has been an unsanctioned attempt to use computer facilities for private purposes including so-called mining . ''
the supercomputer was not supposed to be connected to the internet - to prevent intrusion - and once the scientists attempted to do so , the nuclear centre 's security department was alerted .
they were handed over to the federal security service , the russian news service mash says .
read more here .

documents.title: wall street recovers - sort of
text: another rollercoaster ride in new york today , but all three main indexes reversed earlier losses to end the day higher .
the dow jones and the nasdaq both closed up 1.4 % , while the s & p 500 gained 1.5 % .
however , the dow and s & p have both ended the week 5.2 % lower - the biggest weekly declines for both since january 2016 .
the nasdaq only did slightly better , posting a 5.1 % decline for the week .

documents.title: 'sloppy territory '
text: confused about what 's been happening on wall street today ?
you 're not alone .
the s & p 500 has gone from being up 1.5 % to down 1.9 % in the space of a few hours on friday , echoing the big swings of the past week , while the dow moved in a range of more than 800 points .
`` i just think the market has to find new footing here , '' says peter tuz at chase investment counsel in charlottesville , virginia .
`` we are in very sloppy territory , until we 're not in sloppy territory . ''

documents.title: sweeney vs rollins
text: on the basis that the music industry is very much part of the business world , we bring you this tweet from our colleagues on bbc2 's newsnight :
tonight : @ twitterid goes into the ring with punk icon and bad boy henry rollins for a friday night arm wrestle - 22:30 on bbc two # newsnight
love it !
street fighters the both of ya : )
i like john sweeney but i think hank has go this .
do n't usually watch any bbc news output but this could be worth watching .

documents.title: oil prices slide
text: us crude oil ended the day down 3.2 % at $ 59.20 - the lowest since just before christmas , while the price of a barrel of brent crude dropped 3.1 % to $ 62.79 .
the falls means both us and brent crude have lost more than 11 % from this year 's peak late last month .

documents.title: japan raids cryptocurrency exchanges
text: japan has expanded raids on cryptocurrency exchanges following the world 's biggest digital currency theft .
authorities are checking whether adequate security systems are in place .
officials plan to inspect more exchanges after searching the offices of coincheck last week .
thieves stole $ 534m ( £ 382m ) from that exchange in january .
another tokyo exchange , mtgox , collapsed in 2014 after admitting that $ 400m had been stolen from its network .

documents.title: delivery firms shares slide on amazon report
text: the online retailer is reportedly planning a new service called `` shipping with amazon '' that will allow it to up packages from businesses and deliver them to consumers .
the service is expected to start in los angeles in the coming weeks , before it is rolled out more broadly as soon as this year , according to the wall street journal .
shares of shipping companies fedex and ups slipped on friday in the wake of the report .
amazon , which has been edging into the delivery business for some time , did not issue a denial .

kristen kish , an amazon spokeswoman , said : `` we 're always innovating and experimenting on behalf of customers and the businesses that sell and grow on amazon to create faster lower-cost delivery choices . ''
an amazon entry into the delivery business would `` send shivers down the spines of the traditional delivery companies '' , said neil saunders , the managing director of globaldata retail .
he wrote : `` the danger for the traditional delivery firms is two-fold .
firstly , they are likely to lose business from amazon ; this will be slow at first but will accelerate as amazon rolls out more of its own delivery services .
secondly , if amazon starts offering delivery to businesses , it will likely do this at a reduced rate . ''
amazon has made other forays into delivery .
in august 2016 , the company unveiled its first branded cargo plane , one of 40 jetliners that were expected to make up its own air transportation network .
shares of ups and fedex fell more than 2 % in today 's trading .

documents.title: all about the ipo
text: back to the waymo settlement for a moment , kate conger at gizmodo offers this take - and @ twitterid is uber boss dara khosrowshahi , by the way .
waymo v uber has settled ! !
audible gasps in the courtroom , including me
statement from dara
alsup : the case out there for all you newspaper people is over
statement from waymo
here ya go
basically this is a win for @ twitterid
it 's official
update : earlier this week , uber offered $ 500m equity .
waymo went for the lower amount in exchange for promises of non-use
i 'm still writing in the hallway outside court and everyone has left and the court marshals are starting to make fun of me
alright .
since the jury did not get to decide , the jury of one ( aka me ) has weighed in .
this is the definitive power ranking and there will be no discussion , thank u
ugh this is the most brutal self own of my career but it was 12 muffins , not 14. the post is being corrected and i deeply regret my error .
i understand that you are super impressed but would you say that you are pumped ?
whatever they 're paying @ twitterid they should pay double .
wow .
waymo wants equity for settlement .
google did n't sell in tender offer but tk sold max shares .
things change fast
tk & al out is the win for waymo .

documents.title: more moolah for boa boss
text: it 's going to be a good weekend for bank of america chief executive brian moynihan : the board has given the nod to increasing his incentive scheme by $ 3m to $ 21.5m for 2016 .
but poor mr moynihan had to get by last year with no cash bonus and no pay rise either , meaning his base salary remains at a meagre $ 1.5m .
shall we have a whiparound ?

documents.title: wall street woes
text: speaking of things going down , the wall street selloff seems to be gathering pace .
the dow jones is now 1.3 % lower , while the s & p 500 has shed 0.9 % and the nasdaq composite has fallen 1.8 % .

documents.title: that sinking feeling
text: oh dear - sterling is now almost 1 % lower at $ 1.3786 .

documents.title: pension fail
text: financial times pensions correspondent josephine cumbo tweets :
new from ons today : rate of self-employed people actively paying into private # pensions fell to 25 % in 2016 down from 40 % in 2008 .
is it % with a pension or % actively contributing ?
the headline and the table itself seem slightly contradictory .
% actively contributing .
good job the government 's got an urgent plan to address this ah
spoke to 2 this week , one preferred to invest in property but at 39 did n't have any yet .
another at 52 pays £ 80pm having recently doubled .
got a plan for him .
is this due to an increase in number of low income self empl more than a fall in number of self emp savers ?
still an issue

i 'm not surprised i ended up paying more in than i would have received thank to the lies i was told back in 1995 , pension companies are theives , buy property and sell it when you retire is the best bet , i wish i had now
i 'm se and have been paying into private pensions since 18 ( now 45 ) .
it 's not too much of a priority for myself ( & wife ) , as both sets of parents are retired & own several properties between them .
future income from our inheritance will vastly outstrip any pension .
gob-smacked at size of drop

documents.title: worst week in two years for the ftse
text: the ftse 100 is now down about 9 % from its record high hit on 12 january , making it the worst week since 2016 for the blue-chip index .
but is this correction the start of a bear market ?
`` if we look at other indicators it does n't look the case , '' says rory mcpherson at psigma investment management in london .
`` interbank lending rates are still pretty low , credit spreads have moved up slightly from record lows but have n't blown out , and earnings season is coming along pretty well , '' he adds .

documents.title: barnier comments dent sterling
text: sterling is trading under $ 1.38 after the european union 's brexit negotiator , michel barnier , warned the uk that a post-brexit transition deal was `` not a given '' .
the pound had risen sharply on thursday when the bank of england said interest rates probably needed to rise sooner and by more than previously thought , as global growth helped the uk economy .
sterling slid 0.8 % against the dollar to $ 1.3795 , and was down 0.7 % against the euro at €1.1280 .
barnier 's comments have `` raised the risk that a transition deal may not be as easy to achieve as the market had expected '' , said lee hardman , analyst at mufg in london .
neil jones , at mizuho bank , said the pound `` was pushing lower as the pendulum shifts from a soft to a hard brexit '' .

documents.title: uber 'to pay $ 245m '
text: tech site recode reports that uber has agreed to pay alphabet , which owns waymo , the equivalent of $ 245m in equity .
`` the agreement specifically requires uber to give alphabet 0.34 % of uber 's latest funding series .
sources involved in the negotiations say it 's based on a $ 72bn valuation , '' recode reports .

documents.title: 'big climbdown '
text: technology correspondent is a little surprised by the sudden settlement in the waymo/uber case today :
wow - thought this would run and run .
big climbdown by uber - perhaps another part of dara k 's clean up mission
maybe they had no defence .
a cash award from the court would have upset uber 's shareholders .
and hurt them more than this settlement in shares .

documents.title: breakingftse 100 sinks
text: the london blue-chip index has ended the day 1.3 % lower at 7,078 points after volatile trading on wall street this afternoon .

documents.title: step by step
text: uber had been accused of stealing trade secrets from waymo , google 's former autonomous driving unit .

in his statement , uber chief dara khosrowshahi ( said that `` while we do not believe that any trade secrets made their way from waymo to uber we are taking steps with waymo to ensure our lidar and software represents just our good work '' .
everything you ever wanted to know about the somewhat complicated case is here from our north america technology reporter dave lee .

documents.title: breakinguber and waymo settle
text: uber and waymo have reached an out-of-court settlement four days after a trial began in the us .
the ride-sharing firm was being sued by waymo , the self-driving company spun out of google .

uber was accused of stealing and using trade secrets relating to lidar ( light detection and ranging ) - one of the technologies that enables an autonomous car to understand what is happening around it .
uber chief executive dara khosrowshahi has posted a statement here .

documents.title: dow turns negative
text: that us market rally is fast losing steam : the dow is now in the red , down 0.2 % , although the far broader s & p 500 is still almost 0.9 % higher .
us crude oil has also fallen under the $ 60 mark .

documents.title: homepod day
text: apple shares are up 1.4 % - although that is probably not directly related to the homepod going on sale in the uk today we admit .
ben wood , a mobile analyst at ccs insight , says the gadget is proving popular at one apple store at least .
homepod day at @ twitterid regent street flagship store in london .
seems to be flying off the shelves so far !
# homepod # siri
can you listen to it in the store ?
was wandering how they demonstrate/sell it .
yes .
they have several live units in store you can interact with ( under supervision ) and it worked well .
surprising there was no dedicated homepod area '' or table which i thought was a shame .
interesting .
wonder how long till some turns it up to 100 by the way did you notice , they now sell libratone speakers at apple stores as well .
i think that is why they are closely supervising them ; )
how the lack of support for android and spotify could benifit apple

documents.title: oil heads south
text: oil prices are down for the sixth day and are on track for their biggest weekly loss in 10 months , as record us crude output added to concerns about a sharp rise in global supplies .
brent crude is down 81 cents at $ 64 a barrel after earlier falling as low as $ 63.70 , while us oil fell 80 cents to $ 60.35 a barrel .
both are down more than 9 % from this year 's highs late last month .

documents.title: sterling still struggling
text: speaking of things going down , sterling is still hovering around the $ 1.38 level against the dollar , down 0.7 % on the day .

documents.title: two dow laggards
text: there are just two fallers among the 30 stocks on the dow jones thus far : exxon mobil and general electric .
ups is the biggest faller on the s & p , meanwhile , shedding 3.7 % as investors worry about a report suggesting amazon plans to launch its own delivery service .

documents.title: breakingwall street rebounds
text: us stock markets opened sharply higher as technology and financial stocks rose , but the s & p 500 and dow jones industrial average remained on course for their biggest weekly losses in at least six years .
the dow and the s & p both jumped almost 1 % , while the nasdaq composite added 1.1 % .

documents.title: 'legal bar ' on rbs report
text: the financial conduct authority says it is legally prevented from publishing a report into misconduct by royal bank of scotland during the global financial crisis that has been requested by a parliament committee .

fca chief executive andrew bailey says it is `` highly unlikely '' that it would be able to publish the report into rbs 's treatment of small businesses by a 16 february deadline set by the commons treasury committee earlier this week .
mr bailey will give mps a copy of the report - extracts of which have already been leaked - by that date if they made a further formal request , but urged them against publishing it themselves .

`` if the committee decides itself to publish the report , it will no doubt want to consider carefully the precedent of publishing a document obtained from the fca under parliamentary privilege where the fca considers that it is legally constrained from publishing the document itself , '' he said .

documents.title: what is the vix index ?
text: the current market volatility means that investors are suddenly interested in the vix again .
but what exactly is it ?
click on the video below if you want to know .

documents.title: jobs , jobs , jobs
text: us president donald trump has been at the tweet button again .
us lawmakers vote to pass a two-year budget , means the government 's second shutdown in three weeks should end before the working day begins .
just signed bill .
our military will now be stronger than ever before .
we love and need our military and gave them everything
you have no idea what is even in this bill .
stop acting like you do don
don ?
u just showed how disrespectful u r .

you 've alienated out allies .
he loves the military so much that he went to play golf more times than he visited our fighting men and women .
how many times did he visit ?
zero .
such love !
so quick to criticize .
how many times did obama sneek off to play golf .
at least this president knows how to do business on the course
what we know with multiple bankruptcies is that business is not his strong suit .
he has you fooled .
our military , very important ppl representing the usa !
treat them fare

if u do n't know who & what pres trump has stopped or ran aground , u need to read more & pay attention !

come on , yur writing this tweet .

thanks to the tax cuts and jobs act passed by the republican congress and signed by president donald trump , houston-based insperity is providing $ 4,000 tax reform bonuses to employees who have been with the company for more than two years .
the $ 4,000 bonuses set the new benchmark and invite a challenge to companies to be the first to give $ 5,000 bonuses .
tricare has gotten worse on your watch .
yet you `` ordered '' a military parade ?
are you kidding me ?
we do n't need a parade to stroke your ego .
we need our prescriptions covered .
we need more doctors ( we now have fewer network providers ) .
we do n't need our premiums increased .
these tricare cuts have been going on alot longer than 1 yr. yur buddy bho started the cuts .
dr 's dont want to accept tricare bc the reimbursements stink .
show me .

documents.title: thumbs up or down ?
text: facebook has revealed that it is testing a new `` downvote '' button that will let people hide comments and provide feedback about them .
however , the social network has denied that the new feature is a `` dislike '' button , which many facebook users have requested .
the downvote button is being tried out by a small number of us users .
the company has also announced a number of other measures aimed at improving the facebook community .
`` we are exploring a feature for people to give us feedback about comments on public page posts .
this is running for a small set of people in the us only , '' the company said in a statement .
read more here

documents.title: amazon set to deliver its own parcels
text: ups , fedex and dhl beware - amazon is apparently preparing to launch its own delivery service , according to the wall street journal .
the `` shipping with amazon '' service will see the internet giant delivering packages from businesses to consumers .
the service is expected to be rolled out in coming weeks and will initially only be available in los angeles .

documents.title: trinity mirror shares still up
text: trinity mirror shares are still up 5 % following this morning 's announcement of a deal .
analysts peel hunt says the £ 126.7m trinity mirror is paying for the publishing assets of northern & shell , is `` a very modest price '' .
it has kept its `` buy '' rating on the shares and says it expects the deal to support the company 's current valuation and its 190p target price .

documents.title: barnier blow
text: until mr barnier spoke the pound had been trading in positive territory , boosted by the bank of england 's comments on thursday that interest rates would probably need to rise sooner , and by more than it had previously thought .
against the dollar , sterling is now at its lowest level since mid-january .

documents.title: sterling hit by eu comments
text: sterling is still down against the pound and the euro this morning .
it 's currently 0.8 % lower against both the dollar and the euro at $ 1.38050 and €1.12680 respectively .
ofx analyst hamish muress has linked the fall to comments from michel barnier , the eu 's chief negotiator warning that a transition period immediately after brexit in 2019 is `` not a given '' .
`` over half of the gains that the pound made since the start of the year against the dollar have been wiped out .
`` the losses against the euro are even more pronounced .

with brexit once again moving back onto the markets ' radar , risk of a sterling downturn has returned and even the bank of england 's aggressive policy outlook has n't provided much support to the pound , '' he notes .

documents.title: eurostar launching new high-speed rail service
text: eurostar is launching a london-amsterdam service that will take just 3hr 41 minutes , and a london-rotterdam service that will take 3 hours .
the new service launches on 4 april and there will be two trains a day .

the launch of our service to the netherlands represents an exciting advance in cross-channel travel and heralds a new era in international high speed rail , '' said eurostar 's chief executive nicolas petrovic .
`` with direct services from the uk to the netherlands , france and belgium , we are transforming the links between the uk and three of europe 's top trading nations . ''

documents.title: uk economy grew 0.5 % , says niesr
text: the national institute of economic and social research ( niesr ) also said it believes the british economy grew by 0.5 % for the three months to 31 january 2018 .
earlier this week , niesr forecast that britain 's economy would grow by 1.9 % this year and next - slightly faster than the bank of england predicted on thursday. ``
at this speed , the economy could start to overheat unless the bank of england withdraws some of the stimulus that it has injected by raising the policy rate , '' niesr economist amit kara said .
a failure of brexit talks would cause `` a marked slowdown with damaging longer term consequences '' , she added .

documents.title: france and germany call for g20 action on crypto-currencies
text: financial regulators in france and germany are calling for crypto-currencies to be put on the agenda for the upcoming g20 meeting in buenos aires , argentina .

central bank governors and finance ministers have called for an international report on the implications of virtual currencies , as well as a report on crypto-currencies ' financial stability implications by the international monetary fund .
they also want to see the start of `` transboundary '' action towards regulating virtual currencies .

`` we believe there may be new opportunities arising from the tokens and the technologies behind them , '' wrote french finance minister bruno le maire , his german counterpart peter altmaier , french central bank governor francois villeroy de galhau and his german colleague jens weidmann .
`` however , tokens could pose substantial risks for investors and can be vulnerable to financial crime without appropriate measures .
in the longer run , potential risks in the field of financial stability may emerge as well . ''

documents.title: ford of europe applies for german banking licence
text: ford of europe has applied for a german banking licence , in case the carmaker 's bank is unable to offer services across europe after the uk leaves the european union .

the reason that ford credit europe has submitted an application for a german banking license is to ensure it is able to provide ongoing support for ford dealers and customers post-brexit , '' a company spokesman said in a statement .

documents.title: uk data 'a more positive underlying
text: consultancy firm ey says the slew of data out this morning for december is mixed , but the overall underlying is more positive .

documents.title: pound slips against the dollar and euro
text: the pound has slipped slightly against both the euro and dollar , losing some of thursday 's gains after the bank of england said interest rates would probably need to rise sooner and by more than it had previously thought .
it 's currently down 0.1 % against both the dollar and the euro at $ 1.38990 and €1.13480 respectively .

documents.title: london almost flat
text: london shares are currently almost flat , after wall street fell by over 1,000 points for the second time in a week , plunging 4.15 % to 23,860 .
the ftse 100 is now down just 0.09 % or 7 points at 7,164.02 .
chemicals firm johnson matthey leads the losers , falling 3.5 % to £ 31.37 after agreeing to take a £ 50m charge to settle a contract dispute in the us .
the ftse 250 has fallen slightly by 0.1 % or 20 points to 19,308.12 .

documents.title: do you recognise this trader ?
text: for journalists markets stories always present an issue - just how to illustrate them .
photos of traders is one obvious way .
it turns out , as as financial times reporter david sheppard has discovered , one trader is particularly popular in such see below .
a study : what is it that makes gregory m. rowe by far the most photographed broker on the nyse ?
pick up any paper or click on any website with a 'brokers shouting ' story/pic and there 's a 50 % chance it 'll be him
you 've seen the face .
you kinda recognise him .
but you 're not sure from where
sometimes he like to add a layer of mystique but the cameras still gravitate to him .
work it greg .
here he is in happier times .
not wearing that hat today , are we greg ?
i mean people think the sell-off is due to inflation fears , stretched valuations , a healthy correction , whatever .
you 're all wrong .
this hat was the top and you all missed , even though he was there , as always , for all to see .
in fact , a quick review of his portfolio suggests greg knows he 's photographed all the time and tries to send us warnings of market tops .
damn this was taken in january 2008 .
greg coulda saved you a lot of money , if only you were paying attention .
anyway : greg - we appreciate all you do .
your nonthreatening good looks have made you the tom hanks of the trading floor .
an everyman we can all connect with , a port in the storm , whether markets are melting up or down .
keep doing you .
he had a dow 15,000 hat in an earlier and now i ca n't stop wondering about how many of those hats he has .
where does he get them ?
do they come in 1000-point intervals ?
do all traders get them when the dow hits a new high ?
why do n't the others wear theirs ?
so many questions !

documents.title: uk growth still on track
text: the slew of economic data out this morning is unlikely to alter the analysis of bank of england officials who on thursday upgraded their growth forecasts for the uk .
the bank said that the improving global economy meant that interest rates were likely to need to rise sooner than it had thought last year .
the fact that neither sterling or government bonds have reacted to the latest data suggests little has changed .

documents.title: bank 's ben broadbent says small rate rise 'no great shock '
text: when i asked him if people are now used to a new normal of low interest rates , @ twitterid dep gov ben broadbent said that was `` true to some extent '' , adding he did n't think a couple of 25 basis point [ 0.25 % ] rises in a year would be a great shock @ twitterid # wakeuptomoney
i think dr b has a salary commensurate with that kind of rate increase !
mean less disposable income for folk unless wage inflation really is seriously on the march !
if two interest-rate rises are not a shock how come one 0,25 % cut is claimed to have such a big effect ?
i hope you will challenge him on this in future

documents.title: 'uk 's trade position weakened '
text: the british chambers of commerce ' head of economics suren thiru says the trade figures for december are `` disappointing '' .

`` although there was a surprise in construction output , the sector remains a concern and together with the widening in the uk 's trade deficit and weakening industrial output indicates that economic conditions are becoming more sluggish .

`` while many exporters are benefiting from stronger growth in key trading markets , imports continue to grow at a solid pace with businesses continuing to report little in the way of import substitution despite their high cost .
`` if this trend continues as we expect , the contribution of net trade to uk gdp growth over the near term is likely to be limited at best , '' he says .

documents.title: gatwick sees record customers in january
text: gatwick airport had its busiest january ever , with 2.8 million travellers passing through its terminals .
us routes saw the highest rate of growth .
fort lauderdale saw the biggest rise in passengers , up 92.6 % compared to the same period in the previous year .
asia routes also soared , with flights to hong kong rising by 42.4 % .

documents.title: construction output shrinks for third quarter in a row
text: the office for national statistics ( ons ) has also released construction data this morning .
it shows output fell by 0.7 % in the three months to december .
it is the third straight quarterly decline , which the ons said marked the longest fall in quarterly construction output since 2012 .
however , on a month-on-month basis , output grew 1.6 % in the final month of 2017 .

documents.title: trade deficit widens
text: £ 3.8bn increase in the total trade deficit to £ 10.8bn in the 3-months to december 2017 , with the with the largest impact coming from ' oil with the impact of increased oil imports accentuated by rising crude prices
among the uk 's top 10 trade in goods export destinations , exports to france and china increased the most , by £ 5.9 billion and £ 4.7 billion respectively , from 2016 to 2017
commenting on today 's short-term economic indicator figures , senior statistician rob pike said :

documents.title: industrial output sinks in december
text: industrial production fell in december , dropping by 1.3 % from november due to a sharp fall in mining and quarrying .
it is the biggest drop since september 2012 and compares with a 0.3 % rise in november .
the main problem was the shutdown of the forties oil pipeline for much of the month .
the forties pipeline , which carries oil from the north sea to the scottish mainland at kinneil , near grangemouth , has now reopened .

documents.title: asia stocks suffer worst week in years
text: the friday closing bell could not come quick enough for asian markets after one of the most tumultuous weeks in years .
wall street 's downward spiral spilled over in asia hitting all major markets hard .
hong kong 's hang seng index fell another 3.1 % to 29,507.4 points - making it the biggest weekly drop since the global financial crisis in 2008 .
meanwhile japan 's nikkei index fell 2.3 % or 508.2 points , to close at 21,382.6 .
that took its weekly losses to 8.1 %
and china 's shanghai composite index closed down 4 %
how things play out on monday when markets reopen is likely to very much depend on how wall street fares today .
`` unless us stocks settle , it 's hard to change market sentiment , '' said hikaru sato , senior technical analyst at daiwa securities .
`` uncertainty is likely to continue for now as the market may need about a month to adjust itself . ''

documents.title: ee tackling rural broadband problem
text: uk mobile operator ee has revealed plans to sell a 4g antenna that promises to bring fast broadband internet to thousands of homes in rural areas .
ee 's simon till said the `` shoebox-size '' antenna would let more people access the company 's 4g broadband service .
the company said it had delivered speeds of 100mbps to homes during a trial in cumbria .
one analyst said the plan would appeal to people who could not get fast speeds through a fixed broadband line .

documents.title: l'oreal does better than expected
text: french cosmetics group l'oreal 's shares are currently up 2 % in early trade following its better-than-expected fourth quarter results .
l'oreal 's chief executive also reiterated their willingness to buy nestle 's 23 % stake in the firm should its swiss shareholder want to sell , also helping lift its shares .
the firm said that like-for-like sales , which strip out new store openings , had risen by a better-than-expected 5.5 % in the fourth quarter .

documents.title: didi chuxing to launch taxi hailing app in japan
text: flagging down a taxi in japan 's major cities is rarely a problem .
it is often just a matter of seconds between raising your arm and being en route to your destination .
passengers are generally very happy with the country 's traditional , high quality cabs , complete with glove-wearing drivers .
so perhaps this is why ordering an unlicensed car via a smartphone app like uber has not proved especially popular .
undeterred , china 's didi chuxing has announced a deal with softbank to develop a taxi hailing app in japan with trials planned `` within the year '' .
didi dominates the china market , having bought out the local uber business .
but it is also looking to other countries for expansion , and recently bought a brazilian taxi business .
incidentally , softbank is an investor in both didi and uber
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: trinity mirror shares soar
text: well there 's no doubt that investors like trinity mirror 's £ 126.7m deal to buy the company behind titles including the daily express , the daily star and magazines such as ok .
its shares have surged over 13 % in early trading .

documents.title: declining asset
text: as the bbc 's david sillito points out , trinity mirror 's £ 126.7m deal for the publishing assets of northern & shell `` is n't a solution to the decline of print , but a way to make the most of a declining asset '' .
`` fifty years ago , the daily mirror and the daily express were britain 's two biggest papers , selling more than eight million copies a day .
today , their combined sales are less than a million and continuing to fall , '' he says .
read more here

documents.title: french industrial production rises
text: french industrial production rose 0.5 % in december , according to the latest official statistics .
the growth was driven by higher production in areas such as software and electronics goods , national statistics agency insee said .
the french economy grew 1.9 % last year - its strongest performance since 2011 .

documents.title: 'it 's a very good deal '
text: trinity mirror 's chief executive simon fox is very pleased with the deal struck to buy the express newspaper group for £ 126.7m .
`` it 's good for readers , it 's good for advertisers , it 's good for shareholders , it 's good for pension funds , '' he told bbc breakfast .
when asked about job cuts , he said that the move would still be positive .
`` if you 're employed by a financially stronger organisation , that 's good for everyone .
there will over time be job cuts because we are going to remove duplication in job functions , '' he said .

mr fox confirmed that trinity mirror does not intend to close any local titles in the next year , and that the political teams of each newspaper under the new group will not be `` mixing in any way '' .
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: british land buys london estate for £ 103m
text: british land has splashed out £ 103m on a south east london estate as it expands its ownership of sites near the new crossrail line .
the woolwich estate covers almost five acres and comprises 56 shops and a number of homes , as well as a small amount of office space .
charles maudsley , head of retail , leisure & residential at british land , says it has `` a long term vision for the estate '' .
he says it will `` deliver space that works for retailers and their customers ; which generates clear benefits for local communities and drives value for british land '' .

documents.title: nationwide reports rise in profits
text: nationwide building society has reported a strong performance for the nine months ended 31 december 2017 .
nationwide said underlying profit increased to £ 883m , compared to £ 866m in the same period in the previous year .
gross mortgage lending was £ 24.1bn , compared with £ 26.2bn in the previous year , and total market share was 12.2 % , falling from 14.3 % in 2016/2017 .
`` the society continued to trade strongly in the period , '' said nationwide 's chief executive joe garner .

documents.title: 'it 's a very wise investment '
text: trinity mirror chief executive simon fox tells the today programme that its deal to buy the express newspaper group is `` a very wise investment '' .
he notes that both organisations are still `` very profitable '' but by coming together they will be `` stronger because it is a tough industry '' .

he says cost savings will come from removing duplication , saying for example instead of sending two reporters to cover the same football match they 'll be able to send them to two different matches and `` improve their breadth of coverage '' .
he also says that whilst northern & shell chair richard desmond is retaining a stake in the business , he will have `` no ongoing involvement in the business '' .
`` editorial decisions are entirely left in the hands of the editors , '' he says .
mr fox also insisted that the political direction of the papers would n't change : `` the daily express is not going to become left wing , thedaily mirror is not going to become right wing '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: will fed still raise rates in march ?
text: investors are expecting a rate rise from the us central bank the federal reserve in march .
but sue noffke , uk equities manager at schroders , questions whether the recent market volatility could upset this expectation .
she notes however that the market fundamentals have been `` quite good '' .
`` we 're in the middle of us earnings season and around 80 % of us firms are beating expectations when reporting profits , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: market volatility set to continue
text: the market volatility is expected to continue in london , with the ftse 100 expected to open 38 points lower
core spreads opening calls update - ftse down 38 points - dow futures up 240 points at 6.36am

documents.title: breakingrichard desmond sells express to mirror
text: the express newspaper group , which includes the daily and sunday express and the daily star , has been sold to its rival trinity mirror for £ 126.7m .
sale talks were announced in september , but a deal between the two has been on the cards for some time .
the sale brings to an end publisher richard desmond 's 18 years as a leading uk newspaper owner , northern & shell , mr desmond 's company , also includes ok magazine .
trinity mirror owns the daily mirror .

documents.title: 'things will get better '
text: ben broadbent , deputy governor of the bank of england is optimistic that the worst of the income squeeze has passed , and the economy is looking up .
people are not seeing the sorts of real world growth they had 10-20 years ago , '' ben broadbent , the bank of england 's deputy governor told wake up to money .

`` the worst of the squeeze was about a year ago and if you look at what happened to real household incomes during the second half of last year they were flat , and if you ask me what 's happening right now in the first quarter , they are starting to rise .
`` the squeeze from that depreciation is coming off , the path from higher important prices is probably at its peak and we are starting to see wage growth improve .
`` so things will get better from that point of view . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: bitcoin 'the mother of all bubbles ' ?
text: the value of bitcoin - the world 's biggest digital currency - is currently hovering around $ 8,000 , after hitting an all-time high of nearly $ 20,000 in december .
its rapid rise in value and volatility means policymakers the world over are now voicing concerns about the risks bitcoin could pose to customers and financial stability .
joon ian wong , a tech reporter at business website quartz , believes concerns are overblown .
he describes the coin as `` a digital gold '' arguing it provides a way to `` store value '' and says it can also act like as `` a decent medium of exchange '' .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: why should interest rates rise ?
text: on thursday , bank of england governor mark carney said that interest rates will need to go up more quickly than previously anticipated to stabilise inflation , which sent the pound above $ 1.40 .
the bank of england upgraded its forecasts for the uk economy to 1.8 % for 2018 and 2019 .
sue noffke , an equities fund manager at schroders , says that strong synchronised global growth is driving this change , and that the uk has been affected , despite brexit uncertainty .
we 'll see a gradual normalisation of interest rate , '' she told wake up to money .
`` unemployment is at a record low and wages , bonuses are starting to rise , so as a result interest rates must start to move too . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: stamping out 'illegal unpaid internships '
text: the uk government has ramped up efforts to `` stamp out illegal unpaid internships '' .
hm revenue and customs ( hmrc ) has written to more than 500 firms over the last three months reminding them that interns classed as workers must be paid the minimum wage .
the government also says it will ask hmrc to focus minimum wage enforcement work on firms using unpaid interns .
`` exploitative unpaid internships should not exist and we will work to eradicate these , '' the government said in response to the taylor review - a review of working practices .

documents.title: can toys r us be saved ?
text: troubled toy retailer toys r us is now seeking a buyer for its uk business .
toys r us employs 3,200 staff in 105 stores in the uk .
but is demand for toys drying up for good ?

`` there are turnaround plans being talked about , but we 're looking at a retailer that is antiquated and is almost being saved as 'a moment in time ' , '' retail expert kate hardcastle told wake up to money .
she said that as children get older , they are now more interested in playing with tablets and handheld video game devices , instead of toys .
`` but it ca n't just be a small amount of appetite for stores and the brand - really , anyone can replicate toy retail now .
we 've seen that in supermarkets and with big brands online like amazon . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: asia markets stumble after wall street losses
text: after thursday 's heavy losses on wall street , asian stocks have once again followed suit in friday trading .
japan 's nikkei 225 index had fallen 3.2 % by early afternoon trading , while china 's shanghai composite tumbled 5 % .
there were sharp falls in south korea and australia too .
if you want to know why asian markets often follow the lead of the wall street , you can take a look at this blog by our asia business correspondent karishma vaswani .

documents.title: panic and mayhem
text: on thursday wall street fell by over 1,000 points for the second time in a week , plunging 4.15 % to 23,860 .
professor brett trueman of the ucla anderson school of management says there are several reasons for this .

we have interest rates going up , investors who had such a great ride up are realising that things do n't just go up , they 're panicking and selling , and computerised trading - sometimes when there are sudden market movements , they are automatically keyed to sell , which exacerbates things , '' he told bbc radio 5 live 's wake up to money programme .
`` but a 10 % correction is to be expected - maybe the stock market should n't have gone up as much as it did as interest rates rose . ''
prof trueman said that some investors are now putting their money into bonds and some are putting it into cash , but he warned that no one should make any `` sudden moves '' at the moment .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
today is a day for stats :
in other news , the government is cracking down on unpaid internships , writing to over 500 firms to remind them that all interns must be paid the minimum wage .
toys r us is looking for a buyer for its uk business , and 900 jobs are at stake at three poultry farms owned by 2 sisters .
plus , we will have more analysis on rising interest rates .
